result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Antwuan Lesure was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court waives court costs for Cts 1 and 3.
Defendant shall pay restitution if any is owed directly to the Clerk of Courts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall submit to random observed testing for alcohol or controlled substances upon requests of Grant County Drug Treatment Court, DOC, law enforcement, or designee. 
Defendant shall participate, comply, and successfully complete Grant County Drug Treatment Court.

Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications per week and document monthly with DOC.
Defendant shall document any interview efforts with DOC.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph Antwuan Lesure in court, in custody.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Joseph Antwuan Lesure.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. and Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to Cts 1 and 3. State will move to dismiss but read in Cts 2 and 4. State will recommend 3 years WSPS (18 months in and 18 months out), consecutive to each other and other sentences currently serving with the following conditions for extended supervision: to pay 1 set of court costs, provide a DNA sample, counseling that DOC deems appropriate, restitution, work full or seek a rate of 3 applications a week. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court dismisses but reads in Cts 2 and 4. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 5 years probation with the following conditions:  to pay any restitution owed, to work full time and if not employed full time seek 2 job applications a week and provide documentation to DOC monthly, document any interview efforts with DOC, to comply, participate, and successful complete drug court, not to possess or consume any alcohol, not to possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed, to submit to random observed testing of alcohol and controlled substance upon request of drug court, law enforcement, DOC, or designee, to provide a DNA sample, serve 60 days in jail for Ct 1, work release granted. If revoked, 71 days credit granted.

Defendant Joseph Antwuan Lesure in court in custody. TC Team. Court indicated that he is eligible and the Team has approved his admittance into the program however the ultimate decision is the sentencing Judge. Court reviewed Treatment Court guidelines and procedures with the program.
from Grant Co. Treatment Court Re: referral

Defendant Joseph Antwuan Lesure appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Joseph Antwuan Lesure. Waiver of preliminary hearing has been filed. Court reviews document and finds defendant knowingly and freely waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Antwuan Lesure appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. not in court. Defendant qualified for SPD but counsel has not been assigned yet. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph Antwuan Lesure appeared by video, in custody from Grant County jail. Attorney Charlotte Wynes, makes a special appearance, appears in court. Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains, charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does qualify for SPD. State requests $2500 cash bond. Attorney Wynes requests signature bond. Defendant heard on bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
